page.title: 14Eighty Years of Change cont.
page.content: finishing at 6 p.m. Children amused themselves with outdoor games. Hoops were popular, wooden ones for the girls,metal ones for the boys. Spinning tops and skipping ropes were great favourites. At the turn of the century,the village itself had no electrcity, gas, or main drainage. Lighting was by candle or oillamps and cooking was done over the fire. On Sundays people would take their dinner to the bakers shop and have him put it in the oven to cook. This cost them half an old penny. Milk was purchased from the farm in the High Street,which is now the shop,and bread and meat would be delivered by cart or bicycle. The average wage of the farm worker was very low and many families had a great struggle to afford shoes.
